title: Cross-Module Usage Detection
description: Tests detection of functions and classes defined in one module and used in another

dead_items.name: exported_unused_function
dead_items.reason: Function is exported but never used by the importing module

dead_items.name: internal_unused_function
dead_items.reason: Function is neither used internally nor exported

dead_items.name: ExportedUnusedClass
dead_items.reason: Class is exported but never instantiated

dead_items.name: ExportedUnusedClass.method
dead_items.reason: Method belongs to a class that is never instantiated

dead_items.name: ExportedUsedClass.unused_method
dead_items.reason: Method is never called by the importing module

live_items.name: exported_used_function
live_items.reason: Function is imported and called by module_b on line 19

live_items.name: internal_used_function
live_items.reason: Function is called internally on line 51

live_items.name: ExportedUsedClass
live_items.reason: Class is imported and instantiated by module_b on line 22

live_items.name: ExportedUsedClass.used_method
live_items.reason: Method is called by module_b on line 23

live_items.name: InternalClass
live_items.reason: Class is instantiated internally on line 52

live_items.name: InternalClass.method
live_items.reason: Method is called internally on line 53

dead_items.name: exported_unused_function
dead_items.reason: Imported but never used in this module

dead_items.name: ExportedUnusedClass
dead_items.reason: Imported but never instantiated in this module

challenges: Tests tool's ability to detect cross-module usage patterns
Requires analyzing multiple files together, not just individually
Verifies that a tool can track imports and their usage across module boundaries
